p: In addition to these applications, there are edible coatings, which are considered as a part of the final product, and they are used to increase the oxidative stability during the storage of different foods; this approach is considered a preservation technique. Hosseini and coworkers developed a recipe based on whey protein concentrate, carboxymethyl cellulous, glycerol, and rosemary extract to improve the color and oxidative properties of the stored sunflower seeds [ 111]. By adding carboxymethyl cellulose, the synergistic effect with the extract prevents the formation of hydroperoxides and conjugated dienes [ 112], and in the case of sunflower seeds, it provides the highest tensile strength, coating percentage, and elongation of the film [ 111].
